intro: Afrosciadium harmsianum, commonly known as the Cape mountain thorn, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features such as succulent stems and reduced leaf surfaces. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species. Its botanical structure reflects evolutionary adaptations to its native habitat.
